author: Matthew Rees
title: Review: Chariots of Snow in ‘Norwich’
text: In the popular mind, Vermont is a hotbed of trendy liberalism, producing countercultural icons that stretch from a socialist senator (Bernie Sanders) to politically committed ice cream (Ben & Jerry’s). The state seems proud of the image: “Vermont Remains a Hippie Epicenter” was the headline for a 2015 article in the Burlington Free Press. Conversely, sports are rarely associated with Vermont—other than maybe ultimate frisbee. But one of the state’s tiny towns has proved to be about brawn more than Birkenstocks. It has produced 11 Olympians, all but one since 1984. Such an achievement takes on renewed interest with...
